data.test_name: Principles of Inheritance and Variation Test - 3

1.q_string:
An abnormal human baby with 'XXX' sex chromosomes was born due to :
[NEET 2015 C]
q_option: formation of abnormal ova in the mother
fusion of two ova and one sperm
fusion of two sperms and one ovum
formation of abnormal sperms in the father

1.q_string:
Fruit colour in squash is an example of:
[NEET 2014]

A man whose father was colour blind marries a woman who had a colour blind mother and normal father.What percentage of male children of this couple will be colour blind ?
[NEET 2014]

A human female with Turner's syndrome:
[NEET 2014]
q_option: is able to produce children with normal husband.

1.q_string:
Select the incorrect statement with regard to haemophilia.
(NEET 2013)
q_option: A single protein involved in the clotting of blood is affected.

1.q_string:
Which of the following cannot be detected in a developing foetus by amniocentesis?
(NEET 2013)

If both parents are carriers for thalassaemia, which is an autosomal recessive disorder, what are the chances of pregnancy resulting in an affected child?
(NEET 2013)

If two persons with 'AB' blood group marry and have sufficiently large number of children, these children could be classified as 'A' blood group:
'AB' blood group : 'B" blood group in 1: 2: 1 ratio. Modern technique of protein electrophoresis reveals presence of both 'A' and 'B' type proteins in "AB blood group individuals. This in an example of
(NEET 2013)

Which idea is depicted by a cross in which the F1 generation resembles both the parents?
(NEET 2013)

Which one is the incorrect statement with regard to the importance of pedigree analysis?
(NEET 2013)
q_option: It confirms that DNA is the carrier of genetic information.
It helps to understand whether the trait in question is dominant or recessive.
It confirms that the trait is linked to one of the autosome.
It helps to trace the inheritance of a specific trait

1.q_string:
Down's syndrome in humans is due to
(NEET 2013)

A normal-visioned man whose father was colourblind, marries a woman whose father was also colour-blind. They have their first child as a daughter. What are the chances that this child would be colour-blind?
(2012)

F2 generation in a Mendelian cross showed that both genotypic and phenotypic ratios are same as 1:2:1. It represents a case of
(2012)

When two unrelated individuals or lines are crossed, the performance of F, hybrid is often superior to both its parents. This phenomenon is called
(2011)

Which one of the following conditions correctly describes the manner of determining the sex?
(2011)
q_option: Homozygous sex chromosomes (ZZ) determine female sex in birds.
XO type of sex chromosomes determine male sex in grasshopper.
XO condition in humans as found in Turner's syndrome, determines female sex.
Homozygous sex chromosomes (XX) produce male in Drosophila

1.q_string:
Which one of the following conditions of the zygotic cell would lead to the birth of a normal human female child?
(2011)
q_option: One X and one Y chromosome

1.q_string:
Which one of the following symbols and its representation, used in human pedigree analysis is correct?
(2010)

ABO blood groups in humans are controlled by the gene I. It has three alleles −I4,IB and i. since there are three different alleles, six different genotypes are possible. How many phenotypes can occur?
(2010)

Select the correct statement from the ones given below with respect to dihybrid cross.
(2010)
q_option: Tightly linked genes on the same chromosomes show higher recombinations.
Genes far apart on the same chromosome show very few recombinations.
Genes loosely linked on the same chromosome show similar recombinations.
Tightly linked genes on the same chromosome show very few recombinations.

1.q_string:
The genotype of a plant showing the dominant phenotype can be determined by
(2010)

Which one of the following cannot be explained on the basis of Mendel's law of dominance?
(2010)
q_option: The discrete unit controlling a particular character is called a factor.
Out of one pair of factors one is dominant, and the other recessive.
Alleles do not show any blending and both the characters recover as such in F2 generation.

1.q_string:
Select the incorrect statement from the following.
(2009)
q_option: Galactosemia is an inborn error of metabolism.
Small population size results in random genetic drift in a population.
Linkage is an exception to the principle of independent assortment in heredity.

1.q_string:
Sickle-cell anaemia is
(2009)
q_option: caused by substitution of valine by glutamic acid in the beta globin chain of haemoglobin
caused by a change in a single base pair of DNA
characterized by elongated sickle like RBCs with a nucleus

1.q_string:
The genetic defect-adenosine deaminase (ADA) deficiency may be cured permanently by
(2009)
q_option: introducing bone marrow cells producing ADA into cells at early embryonic stages
periodic infusion of genetically engineered lymphocytes having functional ADA cDNA.

1.q_string:
The most popularly known blood grouping is the ABO grouping. It is named ABO and not ABC, because "O" in it refers to having
(2009)
q_option: overdominance of this type on the genes for A and B types
one antibody only - either anti - A or anti - B on the RBCs
no antigens A and B on RBCs
other antigens besides A and B on RBCs.

1.q_string:
Study the pedigree chart given below. What does it show?
(2009)
q_option: Inheritance of a condition like phenylketonuria as an autosomal recessive trait.
The pedigree chart is wrong as this is not possible.
Inheritance of a recessive sex-linked disease like haemophilia.
Inheritance of a sex-linked inborn error of metabolism like phenylketonuria.

1.q_string:
Which one of the following conditions in humans is correctly matched with its chromosomal abnormality/linkage?
(2008)
q_option: Down's syndrome -44 autosomes +XO
Klinefelter's syndrome -44 autosomes +XXY

1.q_string:
A human male produces sperms with the genotypes AB,Ab,aB, and ab pertaining to two diallelic characters in equal proportions. What is the corresponding genotype of this person?
(2007)

In pea plants, yellow seeds are dominant to green. If a heterozygous yellow seeded plant is crossed with a green seeded plant, what ratio of yellow and green seeded plants would you expect in F1 generation?
(2007)

Inheritance of skin colour in humans is an example of
(2007)

In the hexaploid wheat, the haploid (n) and basic (x) numbers of chromosomes are
(2007)
q_option: n=21 and x=21
n=21 and x=14
n=21 and x=7
n=7 and x=21

1.q_string:
A common test to find the genotype of a hybrid is by
(2007)
q_option: crossing of one F2 progeny with female parent
studying the sexual behaviour of F, progenies
crossing of one F1 progeny with male parent
crossing of one F2 progeny with male parent

1.q_string:
Test cross involves
(2006)
q_option: crossing between two genotypes with dominant trait
crossing between two genotypes with recessive trait
crossing the F1 hybrid with a double recessive genotype

1.q_string:
Both sickle cell anaemia and Huntington's chorea are
(2006)

If a colour blind woman marries a normal visioned man, their sons will be
(2006)
q_option: one-half colour blind and one-half normal
three-fourths colour blind and one-fourth normal

1.q_string:
Cri-du-chat syndrome in humans is caused by the
(2006)
q_option: trisomy of 21‌st ‌ chromosome
fertilization of an XX egg by a normal Y-bearing sperm
loss of half of the short arm of chromosome 5
loss of half of the long arm of chromosome 5

1.q_string:
Sickle cell anaemia has not been eliminated from the African population because
(2006)
q_option: it is controlled by dominant genes
it is controlled by recessive genes
it is not a fatal disease

1.q_string:
In Mendel's experiments with garden pea, round seed shape (RR) was dominant over wrinkled seeds (rr), yellow cotyledon (YY) was dominant over green cotyledon (yy). What are the expected phenotypes in the F2 generation of the cross RRYY × myy?
(2006)
q_option: Round seeds with yellow cotyledons, and wrinkled seeds with yellow cotyledons
Only round seeds with green cotyledons
Only wrinkled seeds with yellow cotyledons
Only wrinkled seeds with green cotyledons

1.q_string:
How many different kinds of gametes will be produced by a plant having the genotype AABbCC?
(2006)

Phenotype of an organism is the result of
(2006)

Which one of the following is an example of polygenic inheritance?
(2006)

In order to find out the different types of gametes produced by a pea plant having the genotype AaBb it should be crossed to a plant with the genotype
(2005)

G-6-P dehydrogenase deficiency is associated with haemolysis of
(2005)

A man and a woman, who do not show any apparent signs of a certain inherited disease, have seven children ( 2 daughters and 5 sons). Three of the sons suffer from the given disease but none of the daughters affected. Which of the following mode of inheritance do you suggest for this disease?
(2005)

A woman with 47 chromosomes due to three copies of chromosome 21 is characterized by
(2005)

Haemophilia is more commonly seen in human males than in human females because
(2005)
q_option: a greater proportion of girls die in infancy
this disease is due to a Y-linked recessive mutation
this disease is due to an X-linked recessive mutation
this disease is due to an X-linked dominant mutation.

1.q_string:
Which of the following is not a hereditary disease?
(2005)

A woman with normal vision, but whose father was colour blind, marries a colour blind man. Suppose that the fourth child of this couple was a boy. This boy
(2005)
q_option: may be colour blind or may be of normal vision
will be partially colour blind since he is heterozygous for the colour blind mutant allele.

1.q_string:
In a plant, red fruit (R) is dominant over yellow fruit (r) and tallness (T) is dominant over shortness (t). If a plant with RRTt genotype is crossed with a plant that is rrtt,
(2004)
q_option: 25% will be tall with red fruit
50% will be tall with red fruit
75% will be tall with red fruit
all the offspring will be tall with red fruit.

1.q_string:
In Antirrhinum two plants with pink flowers were hybridized. The F1 plants produced red, pink and white flowers in the proportion of 1 red, 2 pink and 1 white. What could be the genotype of the two plants used for hybridization? Red flower colour is determined by RR, and white by rr genes?
(2010)
